littlefish.core.terrain module¶

class littlefish.core.terrain.BinaryTerrain(input_array)[source]¶

Bases: object

2 dimensional binary terrain object.

generate_fish_starting_position(fish_num=1)[source]¶

return randomized fish starting position. Note: fishes can be completely or partially overlapping

Parameters:fish_num – positive integer, number of fish positions to return
Returns:list of tuple, each tuple contains 2 positive integers (row, col) of a random position for a 3x3 fish, where its body will not cover 1s in self._terrain_map
get_terrain_map()[source]¶
get_terrain_shape()[source]¶
plot_terrain(plot_axis=None)[source]¶
update_food_map(food_num, food_map)[source]¶

update the input food_map and food_pos_array, to generate new food map and food_pos_array so that the terrain contains food_num of food pixels (each food only occupies one pixel). If the number of food is less than food_num, new food will be added, if the number of food is more than food_num, extra food will be removed.

Parameters:
  • food_map – 2-d binary array, 0: non-food, 1: food
  • food_num – positive integer, number of food pixels after update
Returns:

food_map: updated food map
Returns:

food_positions: 2d array, food_num x 2, _dtype: uint16, array of food pixel coordinates, each row is a food position, columns: [row, col]
class littlefish.core.terrain.TerrainGenerator(size=(128, 128), sea_level=0.6)[source]¶

Bases: object

terrain object, a square matrix containing altitude

generate_binary_map(sigma=0.5, is_plot=False)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • sigma – filter sigma to filter the world_map
  • is_plot – if True, pop a plot of binary world_map
Returns:

a binary world_map with defined size, 0 means under water. 1 means above water

generate a world_map with floating point with elevation [0., 1.]
